data.mnemonic: If you hold ONE finger horizontally for too long it will start to ITCH (イチ).
data.footnotes: The kanji itself is radical 1: "one"

data.mnemonic: In shock over the illegal U-turn (ユウ), he covered his mouth (口) with his RIGHT hand ().
data.footnotes:
口 (20: mouth; radical 30: "mouth")

, take as "hand"

data.mnemonic: If you take the U(ウ)-Boot (U-Boot: German for "submarine") to AMErika (あめ), then you won’t notice the RAIN. They just know it’s RAINING when the one (一) piece of cloth (巾) they hang out is dripping wet.
data.footnotes:
一 (1: one; radical 1: "one")

巾 (1989: cloth; radical 50: "cloth")

The kanji itself is radical 173: "rain"

data.mnemonic: "Get YEN coins from a teller's window and put the special ones in the blue ENvelope (エン)."
data.footnotes: None

data.mnemonic: The KING rules the three (三) entities: heaven, Earth, and humans. He is the vertical force ( | ) binding them together. The crowd cheers for him, and when he faints, everyone screams "OH (オウ), no!"
data.footnotes:
三 (23: "three)

 |  (radical 2: "rod"), take as "vertical force"

The kanji itself is a variant of radical 96: "jewel"

data.mnemonic: The SOUND that my blue ONkel (オン: German for "uncle") from INdia (イン) makes when he stands (立) on the sun (日) must be truly horrible.
data.footnotes:
立 (73: to stand; radical 117: "standing")

日 (62: sun; radical 72: "sun")

The kanji itself is radical 180: "sound"

data.meaning: BELOW, down; to descend, give; LOW, INFERIOR
data.kunyomi: くだ-さる, した, お-りる, もと, さ-がる, くだ-す, お-ろす, しも, さ-げる, くだ-る
data.mnemonic: The T-bar with the droopy LOWER handle is of such INFERIOR quality that it broke off and fell on the blue CAr (カ) BELOW.
data.footnotes: None

data.mnemonic: Flames of FIRE shot out of the blue CAr (カ). "HI (ひ: German sound for "sniggering"), hi, hi," chuckled the arsonist.
data.footnotes: The kanji itself is radical 86: "fire"

data.mnemonic: HANA (はな) called to her friend, "Look at that beautiful blue CAlla (カ) lily! FLOWERS appear when the plant (艹) undergoes a change (化)."
data.footnotes:
艹 (radical 140: "grass")

化 (238: to change)

data.mnemonic: Under an ornate roof (), each child (子) LEARNS about GArlic COOking (ガク) and practices with a blue pot.
data.footnotes:
, take as "ornate roof"

子 (25: child; radical 39: "child")

data.meaning: SPIRIT, mind; air, ATMOSPHERE, mood; breath; flavor
data.mnemonic: If you put the big blue KEY (キ) in the keyhole marked with X, a SPIRIT-like steam (气) will be released into the ATMOSPHERE.
data.footnotes: 气 (breath; radical 84: "steam")

data.mnemonic: The NINE desperately wanted to be a ten (十) but it was about to fall over. So it used a blue hook-shaped Q(キュウ)-tip to lean on.
data.footnotes: 十 (33: ten; radical 24: "cross")

data.kunyomi: やす-まる, やす-む, やす-める
data.mnemonic: This very CUte (キュウ) person (亻) all dressed in blue RESTs against a tree (木) on her DAY OFF.
data.footnotes:
亻 is a variant of 人 (39: person; radical 9: "person")

木 (69: tree; radical 75: "tree")

data.meaning: metal (esp. GOLD); money; Friday; Venus; "metal" radical
data.mnemonic: He presented two GOLD nuggets ( \ / ) covered () with earth (土) to the blue KINg (キン).
data.footnotes:
\ /, take as "two nuggets"

, take as "cover"

土 (60: earth; radical 32: "earth")

The kanji itself is radical 167: "metal"

data.kunyomi: そら, あ-ける, あ-く, から
data.mnemonic: I work (工) to create a hole (穴) in the roof to see the EMPTY SKY, but instead I see a big blue KUH (クウ: German for "cow").
data.footnotes:
工 (113: manufacturing; radical 48: "katakana e"), take as "to work"

穴 (849: hole; radical 116: "hole")

data.mnemonic: A pitted crescent MOON shone down on them. She whispered to him, "Do you have the GUTS (ガツ) to go to the graveyard? The nugGETS (ゲツ) on Grandpa’s grave will look blue in the moonlight."
data.footnotes: The kanji itself is radical 74: "moon" and radical 130: "flesh"

data.mnemonic: The big (大) spotted (丶) DOG named KEN (ケン) is standing on his hind legs.
data.footnotes:
大 (53: big; radical 37: "big")

丶 (radical 3: "dot"), take as "spotted"

The kanji itself is radical 94: "animal"

data.meaning: to SEE, LOOK AT; opinion; visible; "seeing" radical
data.kunyomi: み-せる, み-える, み-る
data.mnemonic: I bend down (儿) to LOOK AT KEN (ケン), who is lying on the floor all blue. I want to SEE with my own eyes (目) that he is alive.
data.footnotes:
儿 (radical 10: "legs"), take as "bent legs"

目 (72: eye; radical 109: "eye")

The kanji itself is radical 147: "seeing"

data.mnemonic: On this strange chair with a cover, you can only sit until you are FIVE. The cover is blue and doubles as a GO (ゴ) board.
data.footnotes: None

data.mnemonic: Saying "KUCHI KUCHI (くち) coo" to a baby makes it OPEN its MOUTH with delight. But then its lips turn blue because COld (コウ) air gets in.
data.footnotes: The kanji itself is radical 30: "mouth"

data.mnemonic: It's easy to recognize the SCHOOL. Its roof features six (六) wooden (木) crosses (乂) COAted (コウ) with blue paint.
data.footnotes:
六 (76: six)

木 (69: wood; radical 75: "tree")

乂, take as "cross"

Alternate interpretation: 交 (115: association)

data.mnemonic: She grabbed the I-beam (工) with her LEFT hand () to divert attention while she HID A RIbbon (ひだり) in her blue SAri (サ).
data.footnotes:
, take as "hand"

工 (113: manufacturing; radical 48: "katakana e"), take as "I-beam"

data.kunyomi: み, みっ-つ, み-つ
data.mnemonic: When her SON (サン) is feeling blue, she writes beautiful THREE-line poems.
data.footnotes: None

data.mnemonic: This is the triple-peaked MOUNTAIN that my SON (サン) climbs when he is feeling blue.
data.footnotes: The kanji itself is radical 46: "mountain"

data.meaning: CHILD; noun suffix; sign of the rat; "child" radical
data.mnemonic: A long-armed CHILD named SUE (ス) is lying on a blue COtton (こ) SHEet (シ).
data.footnotes: The kanji itself is radical 39: "child"

data.kunyomi: よ, よっ-つ, よ-つ, よん
data.mnemonic: FOUR corners of the square were supposed to be marked, but SHE (シ) ran out of steam after two.
data.footnotes: None

data.mnemonic: Skeins of THREAD are laid out on a blue SHEet (シ).
data.footnotes: The kanji itself is radical 120: "thread"

data.meaning: CHARACTER, letter; word; SECTION OF VILLAGE
data.mnemonic: A child (子) at her home (宀) in a remote SECTION OF THE VILLAGE studies the Chinese CHARACTERS embroidered on her mother’s blue JEAns (ジ).
data.footnotes:
子 (25: child; radical 39: "child")

宀 (radical 40: "katakana u"), take as "home"

data.mnemonic: This EAR looks just like the one on my blue robot MIMI (みみ).
data.footnotes: The kanji itself is radical 128: "ear"

data.kunyomi: なな-つ, なな, なの
data.mnemonic: SHE CHEAted (シチ) and turned the SEVEN upside down. "NA-NA (なな: German "scolding" sound)," scolded her partner.
data.footnotes: None

data.mnemonic: He saw a blue two-wheeled rickSHAW (シャ) and decided to make it into a CAR.
data.footnotes: The kanji itself is radical 159: "vehicle"

data.meaning: HAND, arm; performer of an action; manually handled; means; skill; trouble; "hand" radical
data.mnemonic: A HAND with fingers spread out will never fit in the tiny blue SHOE (シュ).
data.footnotes: The kanji itself is radical 64: "hand"

data.mnemonic: A roman numeral TEN (X) is balancing on its TOEs (とお) until they turn blue.
data.footnotes: The kanji itself is radical 24: "cross"

data.meaning: to exit, leave, go out, COME OUT, put out, protrude
data.mnemonic: When I DARE (でる) to COME OUT from behind the bamboo SHOOTS (シュツ), I see mountain (山) upon mountain (山).
data.footnotes: 山 (24: mountain; radical 46: "mountain")

data.onyomi: ニョ, ジョ, ニョウ
data.mnemonic: The kneeling WOMAN with the outstretched arms was the one who dated short, blue-haired JOE (ジョ).
data.footnotes: The kanji itself is radical 38: "woman"

data.kunyomi: こ, ちい-さい, お
data.mnemonic: In his magic SHOW (ショウ) he uses a blue COat (こ) to turn a hook (亅) into two SMALL needles ()—and says he is not CHEAting (ちい(さい)).
data.footnotes:
亅 (radical 6: "barb"), take as "hook"

, take as "two small needles"

The kanji itself is radical 42: "little"

data.kunyomi: のぼ-せる, うわ, あ-げる, のぼ-る, のぼ-す, うえ, かみ, あ-がる
data.mnemonic: That bar has a handle that sticks UP ABOVE the baseline. Whenever JOE (ジョウ) is blue he tries to balance on the handle on one foot.
data.footnotes: None

data.mnemonic: Blue-haired MORRIs (もり) said that a FOREST has at least one tree (木) more than a grove (林).
data.footnotes:
木 (69: tree; radical 75: "tree")

林 (75: grove)

data.mnemonic: This headless, armless PERSON works as a blue NINja (ニン).
data.footnotes: The kanji itself is radical 9: "person"

data.mnemonic: The WATER of incredibly blue SWIss (スイ) rivers squeezes through narrow banks.
data.footnotes: The kanji itself is radical 85: "water"

data.meaning: right, CORRECT, exact; justice; regular, formal
data.kunyomi: ただ-しい, まさ, ただ-す
data.mnemonic: Whenever he reaches a blue stop sign, SEIji (セイ) tells himself, "To stop (止) at the line (一) is the CORRECT thing to do."
data.footnotes:
止 (129: to stop; radical 77: "stopping")

一 (1: one; radical 1: "one"), take as "line"

data.meaning: LIFE; birth, to GROW; raw; student; "birth" radical
data.kunyomi: い-きる, なま, い-ける, う-む, は-える, き, い-かす, う-まれる, お-う, は-やす
data.mnemonic: A GROWING plant serves as a symbol for LIFE in the SHOW (ショウ) on the stage on the blue SEE (セイ: German for "lake").
data.footnotes: The kanji itself is radical 100: "birth"

data.mnemonic: The PALE plants that grow () on the SHOre (ショウ) of the blue SEE (セイ: German for "lake") appear BLUE when the moon (月) shines.
data.footnotes:
, take as twist on 生 (42: to grow; radical 100: "birth")

月 (16: moon; radical 74: "moon")

The kanji itself is radical 174: "blue"

data.mnemonic: A clear moon indicates that EVENING has arrived. And YOU (ゆう) want to celebrate by hitting the slopes at night on our blue SKIs (セキ).
data.footnotes: The kanji itself is radical 36: "evening"

data.onyomi: セキ, コク, シャク
data.mnemonic: A square STONE at the base of the cliff fell on my blue SKI (セキ) and caused my ISCHIas (いし: German for "sciatica") to flare up.
data.footnotes: The kanji itself is radical 112: "stone"

data.kunyomi: あか-らめる, あか, あか-らむ, あか-い
data.mnemonic: The fire () glowed RED. It melted all the snow, exposing the earth (土) below and making him feel silly for wearing blue SKIs (セキ).
data.footnotes:
, take as twist on 火 (8: fire; radical 86: "fire")

土 (60: soil; radical 32: "earth")

The kanji itself is radical 155: "red"

data.mnemonic: "A picture is worth a THOUSAND words," said the SENator (セン) in the blue suit, studying an image of Jesus with a cross (十) in one hand and a whip (丿) in the other.
data.footnotes:
十 (33: ten; radical 24: "cross")

丿 (radical 4: "katakana no"), take as "whip"

data.mnemonic: A big rod ( | ) is floating down the RIVER, right in the CENter (セン) between the banks ().
data.footnotes:
|  (radical 2: "rod")

, take as "(river) banks"

The kanji itself is radical 47: "river"

data.meaning: AHEAD; before; LAST (week, etc.), recently; tip; DESTINATION
data.mnemonic: The blue-haired SENator's (セン) legs (儿) carried him AHEAD toward his DESTINATION, but his mind was on LAST week and the birth () of his son.
data.footnotes:
儿 (radical 10: "legs")

, take as twist on 生 (42: life; radical 100: "birth")

data.kunyomi: はや-い, はや-める, はや-まる
data.mnemonic: Judging from the sun (日), it must be 10 (十) already. Time goes by QUICKLY when you are SEWing (ソウ) a blue quilt.

日 (62: sun; radical 72: "sun")

十 (33: ten; radical 24: "cross")

data.kunyomi: た-す, あし, た-る, た-りる
data.mnemonic: A FOOT with a heel () and a kneecap (口) constitute half a LEG. It SUFFICES that the blue SOCKs (ソク) go up only to the marker on the shin ().

, take as "foot with heel"

, take as "marker on shin"

data.mnemonic: It is blue-haired SONia's (ソン) job to measure (寸) all trees (木) in the VILLAGE.

寸 (909: measurement; radical 41: "inch")

木 (69: tree; radical 75: "tree")

data.kunyomi: おお-いに, おお-きい, おお

data.mnemonic: I pinned the INSECT () to the bottom of the showcase with a little sign (中) but someone obscured the writing with blue CHEWing gum (チュウ).

, take as "insect"

田 (59: rice field; radical 102: "rice field")

data.meaning: SKY, heavens; weather; nature; top; Uranus
data.mnemonic: The blue-haired AMErican (あめ) TENor (テン) looked up in awe while singing this aria: "Above us all there is one (一) big (大) SKY."

一 (1: one; radical 1: "one")

data.mnemonic: This sturdy plant grows in the EARTH even if DOgs (ド) keep peeing on it.
data.footnotes: The kanji itself is radical 32: "earth"

data.mnemonic: "Hold TWO fingers horizontally and lift your blue FOOT Up (ふた) to touch the opposite KNEE (ニ), also blue."
data.footnotes: The kanji itself is radical 7: "two"

data.mnemonic: The HEAt (ひ) of the SUN powers NIETZSCHE’s (ニチ: German philosopher) blue CAr (か) by DAY.

data.mnemonic: Every YEAR, blue-haired NENa (ネン) brings the person () guarding the well () a blue TOSHIba (とし) laptop.

, take as twist on 人 (39: person; radical 9: "person")

, take as twist on 井 (1470: well)

, take as "ray"

data.meaning: EIGHT; many; specific time of day; "eight" radical
data.kunyomi: よう, や, やっ-つ, や-つ
data.mnemonic: The teacher had a special nose. It would always sneeze EIGHT times—four on the left side and four on the right—always with a tremendous HATSCHI (はち: German sound of a sneeze).
data.footnotes: The kanji itself is radical 12: "eight"

data.mnemonic: "What? HE's YAKUza (ヒャク)? No way! Only about one (一) in a HUNDRED of the white (白) males in this town has ties to those gangsters."
data.footnotes:
一 (1: one; radical 1: "one")

data.mnemonic: Blue-haired MONica (モン) tells her students to dot their i's and cross their t's (亠) in all SENTENCES. Otherwise she is going to cross out (乂) everything they've written.
data.footnotes:
亠 (radical 8: "lid"), take as "to dot the i's and cross the t's"

乂 (to mow), take as "to cross out"

data.mnemonic: This TREE with the sweeping branches has a blue KEY (き) on top so that the blue BOCK (ボク: German for "buck") cannot reach it.
data.footnotes: The kanji itself is radical 75: "tree"

data.meaning: BOOK; basis, origin; this; main; real; counter for cylindrical objects
data.mnemonic: Under the blue sky of HONolulu (ホン) he wonders how much of a tree (木) it takes to make one (一) BOOK.

口 (20: mouth; radical 30: "mouth"), take as "window"

data.mnemonic: He is STANDING there, staring at the huge blue RITZ (リツ) Hotel in front of him.

data.mnemonic: RICKY (リキ) turned blue from all the effort of showing off the STRENGTH of his biceps.

data.mnemonic: Blue-haired RINgo (リン) was the only person who called the two trees (木) in his front yard a FOREST.

data.kunyomi: む-つ, むい, む, むっ-つ

data.mnemonic: In her travels (辶) to a DISTANT land (土), she made sure to have enough food to put in her mouth (口), comfortable clothes (), and of course her blue TOY (とおい).

, take as "lantern"

data.meaning: OUTSIDE; foreign; to exclude; OTHER; detach; MISS
data.kunyomi: はず-れる, そと, はず-す, ほか
data.mnemonic: Because it was already evening (夕) and quite dark OUTSIDE, our blue-haired GUIde (ガイ) MISSED the sharp right turn (ト). We should have gone with the OTHER guy.
data.footnotes:
夕 (44: evening; radical 36: "evening")

ト (radical 25: "katakana to"), take as "sharp right turn"

data.meaning: interval; SPACE; between; relationship; timing; room
data.mnemonic: When MA (ま) has the blues, she appreciates the SPACE in the gate (門) that lets sun (日) into the room.
data.footnotes:
門 (211: gate; radical 169: "gate")

日 (62: sun; radical 72: "sun")

data.mnemonic: You should have seen the EXPRESSION on the lad's (彦) FACE when I showed him the blue GUN (ガン) made of big shells (頁).
data.footnotes:
彦 (lad)

頁 (page; radical 181: "big shell")

data.mnemonic: "Water (氵) turns into STEAM (气) when heated," blue-haired KEIth (キ) explained.
data.footnotes:
氵 is a variant of 水 (radical 85: "water")

气 (breath; radical 84: "steam")

data.meaning: to WRITE DOWN; record; MEMORY; symbol
data.mnemonic: Blue-eyed KEIth (キ) says (言) he himself (己) WROTE DOWN the sequence of events from MEMORY.
data.footnotes:
言 (274: to say; radical 149: "word")

己 (855: self; radical 49: "oneself")

data.mnemonic: Blue-haired KEIth (キ) RETURNED triumphantly with sword (刂) in hand (彐), FOLLOWED by blue-eyed KAEla (かえ(る)), who covered (冖) her head with a delicate cloth (巾).
data.footnotes:
刂 is a variant of 刀 (radical 18: "sword")

彐 (pig's head; radical 58: "katakana yo"), take as "hand"

冖 (to cover; radical 14: "katakana wa")

巾 (1989: cloth; radical 50: "cloth")

data.mnemonic: "The COW with a broken horn? I call her USCHI (うし)."
data.footnotes: The kanji itself is radical 93: "cow"

data.mnemonic: In the middle of the rice field (田) he made a fire (灬) and roasted the FISH that was still on the hook (). Then he said, "Now hand me the spices from the blue SACK, ANNA (さかな)."
data.footnotes:
田 (59: rice field; radical 102: "rice field")

灬 is a variant of 火 (radical 86: "fire")

, take as "hook"

The kanji itself is radical 195: "fish"

data.mnemonic: In the back of the blue KIOsk (キョウ), in a small (小) opening (口) covered by a lid (亠), they hide the map of the CAPITAL's secret passages.
data.footnotes:
小 (36: small; radical 42: "little")

口 (20: opening; radical 30: "mouth")

亠 (radical 8: "lid")

data.kunyomi: つよ-い, つよ-める, つよ-まる, し-いる
data.mnemonic: "At the blue KIOsk (キョウ) they're displaying an insect (虫) that can use its incredibly STRONG nose (ム) to pull the string of a bow (弓)," says blue-haired HuGO (ゴウ).
data.footnotes:
虫 (56: insect; radical 142: "insect")

ム (private; radical 28: "katakana mu"), take as "nose"

弓 (836: bow; radical 57: "bow")
